VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
facility had one CAP as a result of their 2023 Interim Inspection. The facility had a
violation for Rule 113(1)(i) related to central registry clearances. The facility
implemented a new policy and process related to obtaining these clearances,
which has been successful.
Financial Overview
The facility's financial budget and financial audit were reviewed. There are no
concerns.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator (CA) noted the 2023 Interim CAP process related to central
registry clearances has been successful and they have not had any further issues
with late clearances. CA reported they internally monitor licensing requirements no
less than quarterly so they can ensure compliance. CA noted things at The Bridge
are going very well, and they have been able to maintain adequate staffing during
the period of review. CA noted there continues to be positive improvements made
with training, processes, procedures and internal policies.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported they are working on hiring more staff because there has been
turnover recently, after being stable with staffing over the last 6-7 months. Staff
reported things are going well at the facility and they have a very strong team.
They reported having the new Team Lead (Supervisor) start last year has been a
blessing as she is an amazing supervisor and has done a lot of work to keep them

organized, keep things on track, and make sure staff's needs are met. Staff
reported it is a very supportive working environment. Staff reported the new
employee training program is being overhauled right now, which includes
redeveloping the shadow shift process, and new hire binder. Staff reported they
have a staff meeting once per month as well as a RCC peer meeting once per
month, which are both helpful to ensure policies/processes are communicated and
everyone is on the same page. Staff reported they feel comfortable expressing any
issues that may arise, and they feel their feedback is heard.
Youth reported the groups the facility offers are helpful, and participation by youth
is good. Youth reported staff are nice, supportive, care about them, and youth feel
comfortable opening up and talking to staff. Youth reported the food is good, they
like they can help with the menu and cooking, and they get enough food. Youth
reported they have house meetings daily which help everyone be on the same
page. Youth reported they feel very safe and comfortable at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough of the facility occurred on 11/18/24, and there were no concerns
noted. The facility's construction of the laundry room, and addition of a storage
room off the kitchen are complete.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
